summary.para: Lists values that specify when a View displays the Filter Panel.
The filter panel is shown when data is filtered. Otherwise, the filter panel is hidden.
The filter panel is hidden.
The filter panel is always shown at the bottom of the view.
Lists values that specify how many rows are displayed onscreen when a View is scrolled to the bottom.

para.para: When a view is scrolled to the bottom, it displays as many rows as can completely fit into its content area.
Only one row (the last row) is displayed when a view is scrolled to the bottom.

summary.para: Lists values that specify the New Item Row's position within a View.
The new item row is not shown.

para.para: The new item row is displayed at the top of the view.

summary.para: Lists values that specify whether row and cell focusing is allowed.
A View displays the focused row and focused cell. Data editing is allowed.
A View displays neither the focused row nor the focused cell. Data editing is not allowed.
A View displays only the focused row. The focused cell is not dispalyed. Data editing is not allowed.
Lists values that specify the context menu type.

para.para: Corresponds to a menu invoked for a column header.
Corresponds to a menu invoked for the group panel.
Corresponds to a menu invoked for the Row Cell.
Corresponds to a menu invoked for the Summary Panel.

summary.para: Lists values that specify the display mode of a column's filter dropdown.

para.para: A filter dropdown is represented as a checked list (multiple items can be selected/checked simultaneously).
A filter dropdown is represented by a custom template assigned to the property.
A filter dropdown is represented as a regular list of items (one item at a time can be selected).

summary.para: Lists values that specify a column's behavior when a view is horizontally scrolled.
A column is anchored to the vew's left edge.
A column takes part in horizontal scrolling.
A column is anchored to the view's right edge.
Lists values that specify a column's position within a View.
Corresponds to the first visible column.
Corresponds to a column displayed between the first and last visible columns.
Corresponds to the last visible column.
Reserved for future use.
Corresponds to a column whose header is displayed within the Group Panel, Column Chooser, Card View or is currently being dragged by an end-user.
Lists values that specify how column values are filtered.
Cell values are filtered by their display text.
Cell values are filtered by their values.
Lists values that specify the type of the comparison operator used to create filter conditions.
The Contains operator is used to create filter conditions. This operator selects records whose values in the corresponding column contain the entered string.
The Equals comparison operator is used to create filter conditions. This operator selects records whose values in the corresponding column match the entered value.

para.para: The Like comparison operator is used to create filter conditions. This operator selects records whose values in the corresponding column start with the entered string.

Returns "ItemAverage". Corresponds to the menu item used to display a column's average value.
Returns "ItemCount". Corresponds to the menu item used to display the total number of rows.
Returns "ItemCustomize". Corresponds to the menu item used to invoke the Summary Editor.
Returns "ItemMax". Corresponds to the menu item used to display a column's maximum value.
Returns "ItemMin". Corresponds to the menu item used to display a column's minimum value.
Returns "ItemSum". Corresponds to the menu item used to display the sum of all values in a column.
Contains default item captions displayed within the column context menu.
Initializes a new instance of the DefaultColumnMenuItemNames class.
Returns "BestFit". Corresponds to the menu item used to best fit the width of the current grid column.
Returns "BestFitColumns". Corresponds to the menu item used to best fit the widths of all grid columns.
Returns "ClearFilter". Corresponds to the menu item used to clear filtering applied to a column.
Returns "ItemClearGrouping". Corresponds to the menu item used to ungroup the grid.

Returns "ItemClearGroupSummarySorting". Corresponds to the menu item used to cancel sorting rows by group summary values. In this instance, group rows are sorted by the values of the corresponding grouping column.
Returns "ItemClearSorting". Corresponds to the menu item used to clear sorting applied to the grid.
Returns "ItemColumnChooser". Corresponds to the menu item used to show/hide the Column Chooser.
Returns "FilterEditor". Corresponds to the menu item used to invoke the Filter Editor.
Returns "Left". Corresponds to the menu item used to fix a column to the left.
Returns "None". Corresponds to the menu item used to unfix a column (a column takes part in horizontal scrolling).
Returns "Right". Corresponds to the menu item used to fix a column to the right.
Returns "FixedStyle". Corresponds to the sub menu item, allowing an end-user to specify a column's behavior when a View is scrolled.
Returns "ItemFullCollapse". Corresponds to the menu item used to collapse all group rows within a View.
Returns "ItemFullExpand". Corresponds to the menu item used to expand all group rows within a View.
Returns. "ItemGroupBox". Corresponds to the menu item used to show/hide the Group Panel.
Returns "ItemGroupColumn". Corresponds to the menu item used to group/ungroup data by the values of the corresponding column.
Returns "ItemGroupSummaryEditor". Corresponds to the menu item used to invoke the Group Summary Editor.
Returns "GroupInterval". Corresponds to the sub menu item, allowing an end-user to specify a DateTime column's interval grouping.
Returns "Day". Corresponds to the menu item that groups rows by the date part of their values. The time portion is ignored in this grouping mode. To learn more, see interval grouping.
Returns "Month". Corresponds to the menu item that groups rows by the month of their values. To learn more, see interval grouping.
Returns "None". Corresponds to the menu item that applies default grouping mode. To learn more, see interval grouping.
Returns "Smart". Corresponds to the menu item that groups rows according to their date value as compared with the current system date (). To learn more, see interval grouping.
Returns "Year". Corresponds to the menu item that groups rows by the year of their values. To learn more, see interval grouping.
Returns "ItemSortAscending". Corresponds to the menu item used to sort column values in ascending order.
Returns "ItemSortBySummary". Corresponds to the menu item used to sort group rows by group summary values.
Returns "ItemSortDescending". Corresponds to the menu item used to sort column values in descending order.
Returns. "UnboundExpressionEditor". Corresponds to the menu item used to show/hide the Expression Editor.
Returns "ItemUnGroupColumn". Corresponds to the menu item used to ungroup the column.
